original: gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sngon chad ma rnyed pa la sogs pa'i chos thos pas mgu ba ste yid dga' bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sngon chad ma rnyed pa la sogs pa'i chos thos pas mgu ba ste yid dga' bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Pleased means delighted in mind, by hearing the Dharma that was not obtained before.

original: mtha' rnams med pa ni mngon par zhen pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mtha' rnams med pa ni mngon par zhen pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'o //
translated: Without extremes means free from the two extremes of attachment.

original: skye ba med pa ni ji ltar yongs su brtags pa'i skye ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa ni ji ltar yongs su brtags pa'i skye ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: Without arising means without the nature of arising as it is imagined.

original: yi ge med pa ni dag gi spyod yul thams cad las 'das pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas so //
analyzed: yi ge med pa ni dag gi spyod yul thams cad las 'das pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas so //
translated: Without syllables means having the nature of transcending all objects of the mind.

original: gnas pa med pa ni so sor nges pa'i gnas med pas so //
analyzed: gnas pa med pa ni so sor nges pa'i gnas med pas so //
translated: Without abode means without a specific abode.

original: rnam pa de dag gis nam mkha' 'dra'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag gis nam mkha' 'dra'o //
translated: By these aspects, it is like space.

original: de nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral bas rnam rtog las grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral bas rnam rtog las grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: By that very fact, he is free from all stains of conceptual thought, and so is called ‚Äúliberated from conceptual thought.‚Äù

original: rtog pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das de rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' yang yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bur rang nyid so sor snang ba'i tshul gyis sngags la sogs pa ston par /
analyzed: rtog pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das de rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' yang yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bur rang nyid so sor snang ba'i tshul gyis sngags la sogs pa ston par /
translated: ‚ÄúBy the conceptual thoughts‚Äù and so on. The beings to be trained, by their conceptual thoughts, imagine that the Lord, even though he is without conceptual thought, teaches the mantra and so on, in the manner of a wish-fulfilling gem, by the way of his own individual appearance.

original: rnam par brtags pas rtag pas brtags //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pas rtag pas brtags //
translated: ‚ÄúImagined by the imagination‚Äù means that he is imagined by the imagination of the trainees.

original: zhes bya ba la rtogs pa'i thabs su brtags pa gang gis ye shes kyi sres po kun zhes bya ba la ye shes rtog pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' thams cad sangs rgyas kyi sa thob cing rtogs par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rtogs pa'i thabs su brtags pa gang gis ye shes kyi sres po kun zhes bya ba la ye shes rtog pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' thams cad sangs rgyas kyi sa thob cing rtogs par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy which all the jewels of wisdom‚Äù and so on. By the means of imagination, all the bodhisattvas, the jewels of wisdom, attain the stage of the Buddha and realize the ultimate truth.

original: bde ba las 'khrungs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bde ba ni byang chub kyi sems kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: bde ba las 'khrungs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bde ba ni byang chub kyi sems kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: ‚ÄúBorn from bliss‚Äù and so on. Bliss is the nature of the thought of enlightenment.

original: de las 'khrungs pa ni don gyi dngos po'i rnam pa gnyis su med par bsgoms pa ste de las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las 'khrungs pa ni don gyi dngos po'i rnam pa gnyis su med par bsgoms pa ste de las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Born from that is the meditation on the nondual form of the reality of things, because it arises from that.

original: rdo rje 'chang ba ni gnyis su med pa'i sems kyi ngo bo nyid du rtag tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang ba ni gnyis su med pa'i sems kyi ngo bo nyid du rtag tu byung ba'o //
translated: Vajradhara is always born as the nature of the nondual mind.

original: dngos po ni yod pa ngo bo ste /
analyzed: dngos po ni yod pa ngo bo ste /
translated: The thing is the nature of existence.

original: de gnyis su med pa'i rnam pa ni dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyis su med pa'i rnam pa ni dngos po med pa ste /
translated: The nondual form of that is the nature of nonexistence.

original: de'i 'byung gnas so //
analyzed: de'i 'byung gnas so //
translated: It is the source of that.

original: gang du zhes pa ni rgyud gang du rdo rje 'chang ba de nyid dang por rnam par snang mdzad du yi ge aom gyis ston pa ste /
analyzed: gang du zhes pa ni rgyud gang du rdo rje 'chang ba de nyid dang por rnam par snang mdzad du yi ge aom gyis ston pa ste /
translated: In which means in which tantra Vajradhara is first taught as Vairochana by the syllable om.

original: dag pa'i gdul bya rnams rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir gang gis sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad du sprul pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dag pa'i gdul bya rnams rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir gang gis sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad du sprul pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is so called because it is he who emanates as the Buddha Vairochana in order to purify the pure disciples.

original: gzugs med tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi rnam par bkod pas gdul bya rnams dka' bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sprul pa'i phreng ba gang gis bskor ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi rnam par bkod pas gdul bya rnams dka' bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sprul pa'i phreng ba gang gis bskor ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The phrase in the formless way means that the Tathagata and so forth are surrounded by a garland of emanations in order to make the disciples ready for the difficult task of arranging themselves in the form of a Buddha.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba @245b khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba @245b khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to you, O Net of Illusion!

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyud la phyag byas pas bcom ldan 'das la phyag byas pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyud la phyag byas pas bcom ldan 'das la phyag byas pa yin no //
translated: By paying homage to the tantra, one pays homage to the Blessed One.

original: gsung snyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la spros pa med pa'i gsung du bzhugs pa ni 'jig rten dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: gsung snyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la spros pa med pa'i gsung du bzhugs pa ni 'jig rten dbang phyug ste /
translated: The phrase sweet-voiced and so forth refers to Avalokite≈õvara, who is sweet-voiced because he is the speech of the Buddha, who is the embodiment of the absence of conceptual elaboration.

original: yi ge thams cad kyis khyab par byas pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i rgyud gang yin pa de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: yi ge thams cad kyis khyab par byas pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i rgyud gang yin pa de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: Homage to that tantra which is endowed with the assembly of all the syllables, which are the causes of the absence of conceptual elaboration.

original: mig gsum pa ni lha chen po'o //
analyzed: mig gsum pa ni lha chen po'o //
translated: The three-eyed one is Mahe≈õvara.

original: 'dul bar mdzad pa ni chung ma dang bcas pa rnam par dul bar byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'dul bar mdzad pa ni chung ma dang bcas pa rnam par dul bar byas pa ste /
translated: The phrase he who tames means that he is the one who has subdued Mahe≈õvara and his wife.

original: des na gang gi sgyu 'phrul gyi tshul du ma dang ldan pa'i mkhas pas ni de las gzhan pa med pa'o //
analyzed: des na gang gi sgyu 'phrul gyi tshul du ma dang ldan pa'i mkhas pas ni de las gzhan pa med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the one who is skilled in the manner of the magic display of that [union] is the one who is not other than that.

original: yang rgyud gang du rjes su chags ba'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa rdo rje 'chang de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang rgyud gang du rjes su chags ba'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa rdo rje 'chang de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: Again, in which tantra the one who is of the nature of passion, Vajradhara, is praised, [the homage is] connected with the previous [verse].

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the distinction?

original: lha mo dag ces bya ba sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lha mo dag ces bya ba sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [The verse] declares the goddesses, and so forth.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i gnas pa dang / sgeg pa dang bcas pa'i dgongs pas phyag g-yas kyis rdo rje bstod nas gsor zhing phyag g-yon gyis dril bu legs par bsnams te dkrol ba rigs lnga ma lus pa yang dag par bsdus pa'i lha mo dang btsun mo'i tshul gyis 'dus par mdzad pa gang yin pa
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i gnas pa dang / sgeg pa dang bcas pa'i dgongs pas phyag g-yas kyis rdo rje bstod nas gsor zhing phyag g-yon gyis dril bu legs par bsnams te dkrol ba rigs lnga ma lus pa yang dag par bsdus pa'i lha mo dang btsun mo'i tshul gyis 'dus par mdzad pa gang yin pa
translated: With the intention of the innate abiding and the playful, with the right hand he praises the vajra and brandishes it, and with the left hand he holds the bell well and rings it. The goddesses who are the complete collection of all five families, in the manner of a queen, are gathered.

original: de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is what it is called.

original: dam tshig thob cing bya ba byas pas btsun mo'i don 'di nyid gsal bar gsang ba lnga'i sems dpa' chen po'i rim pa las gsungs pa ni gcig gi ste /
analyzed: dam tshig thob cing bya ba byas pas btsun mo'i don 'di nyid gsal bar gsang ba lnga'i sems dpa' chen po'i rim pa las gsungs pa ni gcig gi ste /
translated: Since one has obtained the commitments and performed the deeds, this very meaning of the queen is clearly stated in the stage of the great being of the five secrets.

original: k'i li k'i las rdo rje sems dpa' phyag gis kun nas 'khyud pa la brtson pa dang / gnyis pa ste rdo rje chags mas rjes su chags shing rab tu dga' bar nus pa dang / gsum pa ste rdo rje snyems ma khro bo'i tshul gyis me tog gi phreng ba cung zad 'phen par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: k'i li k'i las rdo rje sems dpa' phyag gis kun nas 'khyud pa la brtson pa dang / gnyis pa ste rdo rje chags mas rjes su chags shing rab tu dga' bar nus pa dang / gsum pa ste rdo rje snyems ma khro bo'i tshul gyis me tog gi phreng ba cung zad 'phen par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the first is the embrace of Vajrasattva by Kali, the second is the ability to delight and be delighted by Vajraraga, and the third is Vajragarva slightly tossing a flower garland with an angry expression.

original: de la bzhi pa ni rdo rje mtshan cha mo ste /
analyzed: de la bzhi pa ni rdo rje mtshan cha mo ste /
translated: The fourth is Vajranamaskara.

original: rab tu dga' ma'i mda' 'phen cing 'bigs bar byed do //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ma'i mda' 'phen cing 'bigs bar byed do //
translated: She shoots and pierces the arrow of joy.

original: de ltar lha mo thams cad 'dus pas btsun mo'i gzugs byed par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar lha mo thams cad 'dus pas btsun mo'i gzugs byed par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand that the form of the queen is created by the assembly of all goddesses.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad ston te /
translated: This teaches the following.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang 'dir gsang ba lnga'i de kho na nyid kyi rim pas kyang bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang 'dir gsang ba lnga'i de kho na nyid kyi rim pas kyang bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Here, O Bhagavat Vajradhara, one should meditate by means of the stages of the reality of the five secrets.

original: glu de dag gis bsdus pa'i don rnal 'byor pas bsgoms na rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje mnyam pa nyid des thob par 'gyur ro //üîΩphyag rgya dang mchod pa'i cho ga rab tu ston pa'i gzhung gi le'u la ni phyag @246a * //
analyzed: glu de dag gis bsdus pa'i don rnal 'byor pas bsgoms na rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje mnyam pa nyid des thob par 'gyur ro // phyag rgya dang mchod pa'i cho ga rab tu ston pa'i gzhung gi le'u la ni phyag @246a * //
translated: By meditating on the meaning of those songs, the yogin attains the equality of the Vajra of the Joyous.

original: rgya dang mchod pa rim par phye ba'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: rgya dang mchod pa rim par phye ba'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: The chapter of the scripture which teaches the rite of the seal and worship is called the chapter on the analysis of the seal and worship.

original: le'u drug pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: le'u drug pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: The sixth chapter.

original: // / phyag rgya dang mchod pa yang kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa dang bral bas sems can rnams la khyad par gyi mthu ster bar mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: // / phyag rgya dang mchod pa yang kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa dang bral bas sems can rnams la khyad par gyi mthu ster bar mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Since the seal and worship also do not bestow special powers on sentient beings without the cultivation of the conventional and ultimate awakening minds,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa bdun pa byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa'i ye shes bskyed pa'i le'u gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa bdun pa byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa'i ye shes bskyed pa'i le'u gsungs pa yin no //
translated: then the seventh chapter on the cultivation of the awakening mind, the generation of the wisdom of the awakening mind, is taught beginning with ‚Äúthen.‚Äù

original: de la 'khor na gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don la gzigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gsol ba 'debs par mdzad kyi mi mkhyen pa ni ma yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'khor na gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don la gzigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gsol ba 'debs par mdzad kyi mi mkhyen pa ni ma yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that the Tathagatas see the purpose of the bodhisattvas who are in their retinue and make requests to them, but they are not ignorant.üîΩThe Buddha is equal to all buddhas

original: tshogs dang chos kyi sku dang ni //
analyzed: tshogs dang chos kyi sku dang ni //
translated: in terms of the Dharma body,üîΩthe great enlightenment,

original: 'gro ba'i don ni spyod pa yis //üîΩsangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pa ste //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don ni spyod pa yis // sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pa ste //
translated: and the performance of benefit for beings.üîΩHe is not equal in terms of lifespan, family,

original: sku tshe rigs dang tshad kyis min //
analyzed: sku tshe rigs dang tshad kyis min //
translated: and physical size.

original: zhes bya ba'i grub pa'i mtha'i rjes su 'brangs na de mi srid pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i grub pa'i mtha'i rjes su 'brangs na de mi srid pas /
translated: If one follows this tenet, it is impossible.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs su chud nas byang chub kyi sems rnams yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs su chud nas byang chub kyi sems rnams yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Tathagatas do not make requests to the bodhisattvas because they have realized and fully know the bodhisattvas' thoughts.

original: tshig mthun par dbyangs kyi sgra skad gcig gis zhes bya ba la dbyangs ni lte ba nas byung nas dung gi sgrar gyur cing snying gi padma'i thig le las byung ba'i tshig gis cha shas lkog ma'i gnas su yongs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tshig mthun par dbyangs kyi sgra skad gcig gis zhes bya ba la dbyangs ni lte ba nas byung nas dung gi sgrar gyur cing snying gi padma'i thig le las byung ba'i tshig gis cha shas lkog ma'i gnas su yongs su gyur pa'o //
translated: In the same words, with a single sound of melody means that the melody arises from the navel and becomes the sound of a conch. The words that arise from the bindu of the lotus of the heart transform into the throat.

original: de nas lce'i rtsa ba las byung ba ni sgra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nas lce'i rtsa ba las byung ba ni sgra zhes bya'o //
translated: Then, arising from the root of the tongue is sound.üîΩ Then, the sound of melody that has the name of a syllable, the words that abide in the tongue, are like this.

original: de nas yi ge'i ming can gyis sgra dbyangs lce la gnas pa'i tshig ni 'di skad de ji skad du /
analyzed: de nas yi ge'i ming can gyis sgra dbyangs lce la gnas pa'i tshig ni 'di skad de ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dung gi sgra ni gsal ba dbyangs //
analyzed: dung gi sgra ni gsal ba dbyangs //
translated: The clear sound of the conch

original: padma'i khams la yang dag gnas //
analyzed: padma'i khams la yang dag gnas //
translated: truly abides in the element of the lotus.

original: padma'i ge sar thig le las //
analyzed: padma'i ge sar thig le las //
translated: From the bindu of the stamen of the lotus,

original: tshigs rnams kyi ni cha shas te //
analyzed: tshigs rnams kyi ni cha shas te //
translated: the parts of the joints

original: lkog mar phyin nas dbyangs su 'gyur //
analyzed: lkog mar phyin nas dbyangs su 'gyur //
translated: become melody after arriving in the throat.

original: dbyangs las lhag pa'i sgra yin la //
analyzed: dbyangs las lhag pa'i sgra yin la //
translated: Sound is superior to melody,

original: slar yang lce ru phyin pa ni //
analyzed: slar yang lce ru phyin pa ni //
translated: and again, after arriving in the tongue,

original: dam pa'i yi ge bzang po'o //üîΩzhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dam pa'i yi ge bzang po'o //üîΩzhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: it is the excellent, excellent syllable.

original: dgongs pa gcig pas ni 'di nyid gcig pa nyid de de lta bu'i tshig mthun pa'i sgra dbyangs des bshad par gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa gcig pas ni 'di nyid gcig pa nyid de de lta bu'i tshig mthun pa'i sgra dbyangs des bshad par gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: By the single intention, it is the same, and by that same harmonious sound of words, he requests the explanation.

original: la la ni rnam grangs yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: la la ni rnam grangs yin par 'dod do //
translated: Some hold that it is a synonym.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi thugs su chud par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi thugs su chud par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi'o //
translated: The Bhagavat, etc. Since it is the very essence of what is to be realized by the Buddhas of the three times, it is the essence of all Tathagatas.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na ye shes so //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na ye shes so //
translated: Since it is the very essence of nondual intuition, it is intuition.

original: gsung rab thams cad kyi @246b snying po yin pas na snying po'o //
analyzed: gsung rab thams cad kyi @246b snying po yin pas na snying po'o //
translated: Since it is the heart of all the scriptures, it is the heart.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar gyur pas na mchog tu dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar gyur pas na mchog tu dri ma med pa'o //
translated: Since it is naturally radiant, it is supremely stainless.

original: byang chub kyi bdag nyid can gyi sems ni byang chub kyi sems te don dam pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi bdag nyid can gyi sems ni byang chub kyi sems te don dam pa'o //
translated: The thought of enlightenment is the thought of enlightenment, which is ultimate.

original: de las lhag par gyur pa med pas na bla na med pa ste 'dis ni chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de las lhag par gyur pa med pas na bla na med pa ste 'dis ni chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is unsurpassed because there is nothing higher than it. This teaches the essence of the body of truth.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi'o //
translated: It is of all the transcendent lords because it is the essence of the great seal of Vairochana and so forth.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa'i ye shes yongs su gyur pa yin pas na ye shes so //
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa'i ye shes yongs su gyur pa yin pas na ye shes so //
translated: It is intuition because it is the transformation of the intuition described above.

original: gzod ma nas ma skyes par lhag par mos pas rnam par bsgoms par gyur pas na snying po'o //
analyzed: gzod ma nas ma skyes par lhag par mos pas rnam par bsgoms par gyur pas na snying po'o //
translated: It is the essence because it is the cultivation of the imagination of the uncreated from the beginning.

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i rnam par dgod pa la bzhugs pa'i lha 'khor lor ston pas na mchog tu dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i rnam par dgod pa la bzhugs pa'i lha 'khor lor ston pas na mchog tu dri ma med pa'o //
translated: It is the most pure because it is the teaching of the circle of deities abiding in the arrangement of the great yoga.

original: byang chub thob pa'i thabs kyi mchog gi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas byang chub kyi sems te kun rdzob bo //
analyzed: byang chub thob pa'i thabs kyi mchog gi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas byang chub kyi sems te kun rdzob bo //
translated: It is the spirit of enlightenment because it is the essence of the supreme means for attaining enlightenment. This is the conventional spirit of enlightenment.

original: thabs thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pas bla na med pa ste /
analyzed: thabs thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pas bla na med pa ste /
translated: It is unsurpassed because it is the supreme of all means.

original: 'dis ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin te 'brel bas bstan pa las 'di ltar yang shes par bya'o //

analyzed: rdo rje'i lta ba'i rol pas bltas pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni ldem bag 'jo tshul gyis bltas pa'o //
translated: one should look with the play of the vajra gaze.üîΩWith both hands and so on.

original: lag pa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis padma bskor ba'i tshul du yongs su bskor nas spyi bor me tog gi thal mo sbyar ba byas te gsol ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis padma bskor ba'i tshul du yongs su bskor nas spyi bor me tog gi thal mo sbyar ba byas te gsol ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should make a gesture of supplication with the flower vajra above the head, having completely circled with both vajra fists in the manner of turning a lotus.

original: ji skad rnam pa thams cad du //
analyzed: ji skad rnam pa thams cad du //
translated: In all ways, just as was previously explained.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gis so //
translated: This is in terms of the external and the internal.üîΩHe smiles with a sidelong glance.

original: zur gyis rnam par gzigs pa dang // zhes bya ba ni rnam par lta ba ni gzigs pa ste bzhad pa chen po dang zur gyis gzigs pa ci'i phyir mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zur gyis rnam par gzigs pa dang // zhes bya ba ni rnam par lta ba ni gzigs pa ste bzhad pa chen po dang zur gyis gzigs pa ci'i phyir mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of he smiles with a sidelong glance is that he smiles with a great smile and a sidelong glance.

original: smin ma bskyod pa 'dzum mdzad pa //
analyzed: smin ma bskyod pa 'dzum mdzad pa //
translated: He smiles with a brow that is not wrinkled.

original: zhes bya ba ni smin ma bskyod cing 'dzum pa dang bcas pa 'dzum pa dang 'byed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni smin ma bskyod cing 'dzum pa dang bcas pa 'dzum pa dang 'byed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis so //
translated: The meaning of he smiles with a brow that is not wrinkled is that he smiles with a smile that is not wrinkled.

original: bstan zhing zab pa'i gsung gis ni //
analyzed: bstan zhing zab pa'i gsung gis ni //
translated: He teaches with a voice that is melodious and profound.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad par ston pa'i gsung gi zab mo'i don ston pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad par ston pa'i gsung gi zab mo'i don ston pas so //
translated: The meaning of he teaches with a voice that is melodious and profound is that he teaches the profound meaning with a voice that is melodious and uninterrupted.

original: bde bas byang chub thob 'gyur ldan //üîΩzhes bya ba ni dngos su bstan pas so //
analyzed: bde bas byang chub thob 'gyur ldan // zhes bya ba ni dngos su bstan pas so //
translated: He is endowed with the bliss that is conducive to the attainment of enlightenment.üîΩThe meaning of he is endowed with the bliss that is conducive to the attainment of enlightenment is that he is endowed with the bliss that is conducive to the attainment of enlightenment.üîΩListen!

original: nyon cig ces bya ba ni tshig yongs su bsgyur nas sbyar ro //
analyzed: nyon cig ces bya ba ni tshig yongs su bsgyur nas sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of listen! is that one should listen with a mind that is not distracted by anything else.

original: gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dngos po gang gi chos bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ngo bo ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid de brtags pa'i ngo bor med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dngos po gang gi chos bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ngo bo ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid de brtags pa'i ngo bor med pa'o //
translated: The what and so on refers to the fact that the nature of any entity, which is characterized by selflessness, is non-dual, and does not exist as an imagined essence.

original: mtha' gnyis kyi ni mtshan ma med //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis kyi ni mtshan ma med //
translated: It is signless with regard to the two extremes.

original: ces bya ba ni rtag pa dang chad pa dang bral te chos kyi dbyings thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rtag pa dang chad pa dang bral te chos kyi dbyings thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
translated: It is free from eternalism and nihilism, and is the realm of phenomena that is without beginning or end.

original: de la yang 'ga' zhig 'khrul par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang 'ga' zhig 'khrul par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If someone were to think, But there is confusion with regard to that,

original: de phyir dbus la spyod pa med pa dag / ces te skad cig ma re re zhing 'jig pas na skad cig ma gsum gyi gnas skabs kyi dbus med do //
analyzed: de phyir dbus la spyod pa med pa dag / ces te skad cig ma re re zhing 'jig pas na skad cig ma gsum gyi gnas skabs kyi dbus med do //
translated: the text says, Therefore, there is no middle to be experienced, because there is no middle that is the state of the three moments, since there is destruction in each moment.

original: de med pas na de la mngon par zhen pa ring du spangs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de med pas na de la mngon par zhen pa ring du spangs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Since that does not exist, the clinging to it is completely abandoned.

original: yang na 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i sems dag gis dbus dag na ji skad du bshad pa'i ye shes rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi gnas pa'i sems mtha' gnyis la ltos pa de'i dbus na zhen par byed pa rnam par rtog pa med de /
analyzed: yang na 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i sems dag gis dbus dag na ji skad du bshad pa'i ye shes rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi gnas pa'i sems mtha' gnyis la ltos pa de'i dbus na zhen par byed pa rnam par rtog pa med de /
translated: Or else, in the middle of the minds that possess engagement, the mind of abiding that has the nature of the realization of the pristine wisdom that was explained, in relation to the two extremes, is not conceptual, since it is not attached to the middle.

original: dga' ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is without joy.

original: dus gsum nyid la yongs su gnas pa'i dus gsum po med pas dus gsum 'das pa'o zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dus gsum nyid la yongs su gnas pa'i dus gsum po med pas dus gsum 'das pa'o zhes snga ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: Since the three times themselves are completely present, the three times do not exist, and so it is beyond the three times.

original: thams cad du khyab pas na nam mkha' 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad du khyab pas na nam mkha' 'dra ba'o //
translated: It is like space, since it pervades everything.

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ltar 'di lta bu'i ye shes la gnas par gyur na /üîΩde rtogs pa'i @267a * //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ltar 'di lta bu'i ye shes la gnas par gyur na / de rtogs pa'i @267a * //
translated: In that way, when one has come to abide in such pristine wisdom,üîΩthe realization

original: mtshan nyid can gyi byang chub nyams su myang bar bya ba med pas /
analyzed: mtshan nyid can gyi byang chub nyams su myang bar bya ba med pas /
translated: of the enlightenment that has the nature of that realization does not exist.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bsgom pa'i thabs kyi ye shes dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bsgom pa'i thabs kyi ye shes dang bral ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is free from the pristine wisdom of the method of meditation on Vairocana and so forth.

original: de las ji skad du bshad pa de'i ye shes rtogs par 'dod pa'i thabs rnams ngas bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de las ji skad du bshad pa de'i ye shes rtogs par 'dod pa'i thabs rnams ngas bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: From that, I will explain the methods for realizing the wisdom as it is explained.

original: phung po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phung po lnga la bdag nyid kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas so sor snang bar gyur ba'i dngos po ni dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: phung po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la phung po lnga la bdag nyid kyi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas so sor snang bar gyur ba'i dngos po ni dngos po med pa ste /
translated: In the five aggregates, etc. The entity of the five aggregates, which appears as the apprehended object and apprehending subject in the aspect of one's own self, is non-existent.

original: don dam par sems can dmigs su med pas dngos po de nyid ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: don dam par sems can dmigs su med pas dngos po de nyid ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: That entity itself is the characteristic of non-dual wisdom, because ultimately sentient beings are not observed.

original: sems can la phan 'dogs par byed pa sbyor ba la sogs pa byang chub kyi sems kyi grogs su gyur pa sprul pa dang bcas pas sems can la rjes su phan 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: sems can la phan 'dogs par byed pa sbyor ba la sogs pa byang chub kyi sems kyi grogs su gyur pa sprul pa dang bcas pas sems can la rjes su phan 'dogs par byed de /
translated: The one who benefits sentient beings, the one who assists the mind of enlightenment such as in the stage of preparation, etc., benefits sentient beings through emanations.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sprul pa'i rgyu mdzad pa'i ngag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis sku gsum gyi mchog dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams mchod nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sprul pa'i rgyu mdzad pa'i ngag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes kyis sku gsum gyi mchog dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams mchod nas /
translated: Having worshipped the supreme of the three bodies, the deities of the mandala, with mundane wisdom, such as the cause of emanations of the Tathagata, etc.,

original: bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo bor bsdus pa las bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo bor bsdus pa las bskyed par bya'o //
translated: One should generate the deity from the gathering of one‚Äôs own nature into the essence of Vairocana, etc.

original: thabs nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: thabs nye bar bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the method,

original: da ni sems rin po che'i bdag nyid che bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sems rin po che'i bdag nyid che bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the greatness of the nature of the precious mind,

original: sems kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he declares the mind, etc.

original: sku ni zhes bya ba sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: sku ni zhes bya ba sku rdo rje'o //
translated: The body is the vajra body.

original: sems kyi chos rnams bstan pa yis //
analyzed: sems kyi chos rnams bstan pa yis //
translated: By teaching the dharmas of the mind,

original: zhes bya ba ni chos ston pa'i ngo bo gsung rdo rje thob pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos ston pa'i ngo bo gsung rdo rje thob pa'o //
translated: one attains the essence of teaching the Dharma, the vajra speech.

original: sems kyis byang chub thob gyur pas //
analyzed: sems kyis byang chub thob gyur pas //
translated: By the mind one attains enlightenment,

original: zhes bya ba ni thugs rdo rje'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thugs rdo rje'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: the nature of the vajra mind.

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa de rnams la yang dngos por mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩde bzhin nyid kyi rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa de rnams la yang dngos por mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir / de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par bsgom //
translated: In order to teach that one should not cling to those vajra body, etc., as real entities,üîΩhe declares meditation on the aspect of suchness.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par bsgom pa'o //
translated: Meditation on the aspect of suchness.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la mngon par zhugs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i skur ji ltar bsgom zhe na /üîΩsems ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la mngon par zhugs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i skur ji ltar bsgom zhe na / sems ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Since one has entered into nondual pristine awareness, how does one meditate on the form of Vairochana and so forth?

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis sems sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnam par yongs su gyur pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam pa rang dbang du gyur par mos pas rab tu bsgom zhing bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis sems sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnam par yongs su gyur pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam pa rang dbang du gyur par mos pas rab tu bsgom zhing bsam par bya'o //
translated: The mind, having become the nature of the vajra body and so forth, is to be imagined as having the aspect of an illusion, and to be well cultivated by the power of belief.

original: de bas sku rdo rje la sogs par mngon par byang chub pa yang sgyu ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de bas sku rdo rje la sogs par mngon par byang chub pa yang sgyu ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: Thus, the manifest enlightenment as the vajra body and so forth is like an illusion.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpe gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpe gsungs pa'o //
translated: The example is stated in For example, and so forth.

original: gyo mo zhes bya ba la gyo mo la sogs pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: gyo mo zhes bya ba la gyo mo la sogs pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: The word potsherd is used in the sense of a potsherd and so forth.

original: zhen pa'i sems la @267b zhes bya ba ni sems chos nyid kyis nye bar bsgos pas so //
analyzed: zhen pa'i sems la @267b zhes bya ba ni sems chos nyid kyis nye bar bsgos pas so //
translated: The word mind is used in the sense of the mind that is attached.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dpes bstan pa'i don gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dpes bstan pa'i don gsungs te /
translated: The meaning of the example is stated in Just so, and so forth.

original: bsod nams ye shes kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshogs kyis zhes bya ba blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshogs kyis zhes bya ba blta bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of merit and wisdom‚Äù should be understood as the collection that has the nature of merit and the nature of wisdom.

original: tshogs kyi bsgos pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i tshogs dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: tshogs kyi bsgos pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i tshogs dang ldan pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind that is imbued with the collection‚Äù is endowed with the collection that was explained previously.

original: sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the natural luminosity of the mind,

original: da ni glo bur gyi dri ma can nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni glo bur gyi dri ma can nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach about its adventitious stains,

original: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThings,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe ultimate nature of those things, which is the absence of the nature of things, is the characteristic of the nature of nonexistence.

original: dngos po de rnams kyi don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba nyid dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid can yin par mi shes pas gzugs la sogs pa mi bden zhing yod pa ma yin pa'i dngos po
analyzed: dngos po de rnams kyi don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba nyid dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid can yin par mi shes pas gzugs la sogs pa mi bden zhing yod pa ma yin pa'i dngos po
translated: Not knowing that, one grasps at the true existence of things that are not real, such as form, and so on.

original: la rnam par rtog pas gzung ba dang 'dzin par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis bsgos pas rin po che'i sems dri ma can du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: la rnam par rtog pas gzung ba dang 'dzin par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis bsgos pas rin po che'i sems dri ma can du byas pa yin no //
translated: The precious mind is made impure by the habitual tendencies of the conceptualization that clings to the apprehended and apprehender.

original: de nas rnal 'byor de spyod pa'i gzhung gis kyang dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med par bstan nas /
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor de spyod pa'i gzhung gis kyang dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med par bstan nas /
translated: Then, the text also teaches that things are essenceless by means of the scriptures of the YogƒÅcƒÅra.

original: da ni mdo sde ba'i gzhung sun 'byin pas kyang dngos po thams cad mnyam pa nyid du gsungs pa ni 'byung ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni mdo sde ba'i gzhung sun 'byin pas kyang dngos po thams cad mnyam pa nyid du gsungs pa ni 'byung ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, the text also teaches that all things are equality by means of refuting the scriptures of the SautrƒÅntika.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni sa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni sa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The four great elements are earth and so on.

original: dngos po thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa thams cad do //
translated: All things are all such things as form.

original: ldan pa ni 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: ldan pa ni 'dres pa'o //
translated: Possessing means being mixed.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ni bsten pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ni bsten pa'o //
translated: Form is that which is relied upon.

original: de lta na yang dngos po de rnams la gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba la sogs par yongs su brtags pa'i mi shes pa'i stobs kyis sgro btags pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang dngos po de rnams la gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba la sogs par yongs su brtags pa'i mi shes pa'i stobs kyis sgro btags pa yin no //
translated: Even so, those things are imputed by the power of the ignorance that conceives of them as pure, impure, and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i dngos por yongs su brtags pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i dngos por yongs su brtags pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicate that it is unreasonable to impute the nature of one, many, etc.

original: gcig dang du ma'i dngos po dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i dngos po dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: One and many are mutually exclusive.

original: so sor snang ba'i dbang gis yod pa yin no zhes kyang shes par mi bya ste /
analyzed: so sor snang ba'i dbang gis yod pa yin no zhes kyang shes par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not think that it exists by the power of the appearance of the object.

original: zla ba gnyis su mthong ba yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis su mthong ba yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows, absurdly, that the appearance of two moons exists.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i phra rab cha shas dang cha shas can ma yin pa dang ji lta ba bzhin brtag par bya ba ma yin pa la sogs pa rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i phra rab cha shas dang cha shas can ma yin pa dang ji lta ba bzhin brtag par bya ba ma yin pa la sogs pa rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied extensively to the four great elements, which are not composed of parts, are not to be analyzed as to their composition, etc.

original: de bas na rigs pa rjes su zhugs pa rnams kyis rnam par brtags pa thams cad ni sems can nyid yin pas gnas so //
analyzed: de bas na rigs pa rjes su zhugs pa rnams kyis rnam par brtags pa thams cad ni sems can nyid yin pas gnas so //
translated: Therefore, all of the analyses of the logicians are based on the mind alone.

original: de'i phyir gang 'di gzung ba la sogs par yongs su brtags pa de ni @268a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang 'di gzung ba la sogs par yongs su brtags pa de ni @268a * //
translated: Thus, the imputation of the object, etc.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa ste /
translated: is the adherence to the belief in a self.

original: nye bar mtshon pa 'dis ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs par mngon par zhen pas chos kyi de kho na nyid mi rtogs shing mu stegs la sogs pa'i tshul du byas pas byang chub ji ltar thob par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa 'dis ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs par mngon par zhen pas chos kyi de kho na nyid mi rtogs shing mu stegs la sogs pa'i tshul du byas pas byang chub ji ltar thob par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: This illustration shows that one does not understand the reality of things by clinging to the aggregates, elements, sense-fields, etc. and that one does not attain enlightenment by acting in the manner of the tƒ´rthikas, etc.

original: las dang rjes su 'brel pa gsungs pa ni byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: las dang rjes su 'brel pa gsungs pa ni byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The connection with the action is stated:

original: byang chub ni rnam pa gnyis nyid du gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub ni rnam pa gnyis nyid du gsungs te /
translated: Enlightenment is said to be twofold.

original: gang gi phyir 'di las gzhan pa byang chub ni de rnams kyis 'gyur bas de yang bya ba ma yin no zhes byang chub kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di skad gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di las gzhan pa byang chub ni de rnams kyis 'gyur bas de yang bya ba ma yin no zhes byang chub kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di skad gsungs te /
translated: Because there is no other enlightenment than this, it is not to be made. In order to teach the characteristic of enlightenment, it is said:

original: ji srid du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa la kun du spyod pa de srid du phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog la ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa la kun du spyod pa de srid du phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog la ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as one engages in the conceptualization of grasped and grasper, etc., for that long, the conceptualization of error does not cease.

original: de mi ldog na grol bar ga la 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de mi ldog na grol bar ga la 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs so //

analyzed: rang gi lha'i nga rgyal gyis gzi byin bskyed cing 'bar bar gyur bas rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i rang gi lha'i skur bsgoms pa'i ye shes kyi tshe 'di nyid la ye shes rdzogs par bya'o zhes sbyar ro //
